thread.title: Game 5: It's do or die time for Houston Astros
thread.title_full: Game 5: It's do or die time for Houston Astros

title: Game 5: It's do or die time for Houston Astros
text:
Show Transcript Hide Transcript 
EVENT AS WELL AS WHAT'S NEXT FOR THE CANDIDATES. ALL RIGHT. NOW TO OUR HOUSTON ASTROS AND THE ROAD TO THE WORLD SERIES, WHERE TODAY THEY ARE IN A MUST-WIN SITUATION. THAT'S RIGHT. THE SERIES AGAINST THE ROYALS HAVE BEEN A NAIL-BITER SO FAR. THINGS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO CHANGE. GAME FIVE IS A BIG ONE. WHO NEEDS TO STEP UP THE MOST? IS IT COLIN McHUGH, CARLOS CORREA, JOSE ALTUVE, GEORGE SPRINGER OR THE BULLPEN. CATHY HERNANDEZ IS LIVE IN THE WASHINGTON CORRIDOR. Reporter: ALL OF THE ACTION IS HAPPENING HERE IN KANSAS CITY TONIGHT, BUT ALL OF THE ACTION HERE IS HAPPENING AT THE ASTROS OFFICIAL WATCH PARTY. THE PARTY STARTS AT 6:00. THE GAME STARTS AT 7:07. RIGHT NOW THE SERIES IS TIED 2-2 AFTER THAT VERY HEARTBREAKING LOSS AT MINUTE MAID PARK ON MONDAY. WE PUT THAT BEHIND US AND WE'RE FOCUSED ON GAME FIVE WITH PITCHER COLIN McHUGH STARTING ON THE MOUND. PLAYERS TOOK THE FIELD FOR BATTING PRACTICE YESTERDAY AND OUR SPORTS DIRECTOR RANDY McILVOY TALKED TO THE TEAM'S YOUNG STAR. OH, IT'S SO MUCH FUN. IT'S WHERE WE WANT TO BE. I'M 21 YEARS OLD. INBOUND TRAFFIC -- I WANT TO BE IN PLAYOFF BASEBALL IN THE BIG LEAGUES. YOU DON'T WANT IT TO END. I WANT TO PLAY BASEBALL UNTIL THE LAST GAME OF THE YEAR, THE LAST GAME OF THE WORLD SERIES, AND HOPEFULLY WE GET TO THAT POINT AND HOPEFULLY WE CAN WIN AND GO TO THE A.L.C.S.. Reporter: I THINK THAT ALL THE -- [ Screams ] Reporter: I THINK ALL OF THE HECKLERS, I THOUGHT THEY WERE GONE, BUT DAMON SALES, OUR PHOTOGRAPHER, IS BACK, PUTTING ON A SHOW. OH MY GOSH, CATHY! THAT'S LIKE EVERYONE ELSE IN HOUSTON. THIS GUY HAS ASTROS FEVER. SO BACK TO THAT CLICK2VOTE.COM, I JUST WANT TO SAY, I HOPE EVERYONE STEPS IT UP TONIGHT, THAT'S FOR SURE. OWEN AND RACHEL, BACK TO YOU. HAVING WORKED WITH DAMON PLENTY OF TIMES IN THE PAST, WE EXPECT PLENTY OF ANTICS. THAT'S AMAZING. DAMON IS KIND OF LIKE THAT NATURALLY. MAN, I LIKE THE DANCE, THOUGH. THAT WAS A CRAZY CHICKEN KIND OF THRUSTING THING. I LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT. AGAIN, FIRST PITCH FOR 7:07. THE PARTY AT PLUCKERS STARTS AT 6:00. RANDY WILL BE IN KC. HOPEFULLY THEY'LL BE POPPING CHAMPAGNE AT KC. SFR AND DOING THAT DANCE ALL NIGHT LONG. IT WAS LIKE-- THE DAMON SHUFFLE. LIKE A THRILLER MONSTER MASH KIND OF HALLOWEEN THEMED RALLY DANCE. HOUSTON - 
It's do or die for the Houston Astros Wednesday night in the American League Division Series against the Kansas City Royals.All the action in Houston will happen at the Astros official watch party. The party at Pluckers at 1400 Shepherd starts at 6 p.m. Wednesday.The series is tied after a heartbreaking loss at Minute Maid Park on Monday, but the team is focused on game five with pitcher Collin McHugh starting on the mound. 
“I think any starting pitcher in the major leagues is gonna say and tell you they want the ball in a big,” said McHugh. 
Players took the field for batting practice on Tuesday where KPRC2 talked to the team's young star. 
“Oh it's so much fun! It's where I want to be. It's where I want to be as a 21-year-old. I want to be playing playoff baseball at the big league level,” said Correa.
